answers.author: Evelina Moulder
answers.text:
I just read an article about these cities in Ohio that have a ban--Columbus, Bexley, Hilliard, New Albany and Worthington. You can use the people search in the Knowledge Network to locate staff in those cities, who can hopefully share the ordinances with you.

answers.text:
There's a lot happening at the federal and state level, and the NPR article has some good resources:
http://tinyurl.com/yb9batq
http://tinyurl.com/36gbxw8
A quick Web search using the terms "city texting ban while driving" yields numerous results. This article from Raleigh/Durham mentions penalties:
http://www.wral.com/news/state/story/5394218/
I just also read recently about bans on cyclists texting. Is the message that important, really, that you can't stop a bike?
